articles.author: Pamela Colloff
articles.title: Blood Will Tell, Part I: Who Killed Mickey Bryan?
articles.description: When a fourth-grade teacher was murdered in 1986, her husband, the beloved high school principal, was arrested for the crime. Could he have done it?

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Firm apologises for 'racist' Meghan post
articles.description: An image of a chocolate sweet in a bridal dress asked: "Wouldn't you also want to be Meghan today?"

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/charles-mcgrath
articles.title: Philip Roth, Towering Novelist Who Explored Lust, Jewish Life and America, Dies at 85
articles.description: Mr. Roth won almost all the major literary awards and published an exceptional sequence of historical novels in his 60s, an age when many writers are winding down.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/alexander-burns, http://www.nytimes.com/by/jonathan-martin
articles.title: 5 Key Takeaways From Tuesday’s Primaries
articles.description: A viral video star propelled herself to victory. A teacher unseated an establishment candidate. And Stacey Abrams won a commanding victory.

articles.author: Nick Timiraos
articles.title: Fed Minutes to Offer Clues on Where Rates Are Headed
articles.description: The Federal Reserve will shed more light on policy makers’ outlook for the second half of the year when it releases the minutes of its May 1-2 meeting.

articles.author: Kyle Swenson
articles.title: How Philip Roth’s ‘Portnoy’s Complaint’ scandalized — and forever changed — American literature
articles.description: The 1969 bestseller detonated the wall between low comedy and high art.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Plane splits in half in Honduras crash
articles.description: All on board survived the crash landing of the chartered jet flying from Texas to Honduras.

articles.author: Riva Gold
articles.title: U.S. Profit Boom Leaves Europe Trailing
articles.description: The eurozone’s economy has outpaced the U.S. for the past two years, yet its corporate profits are trailing those in America like never before.

articles.author: Tripp Mickle
articles.title: Apple Avoids Amazon’s Beauty Contest, Searches Secretly for New Campus
articles.description: The world’s two most valuable technology companies, Apple and Amazon, are shopping for cities in which to build new corporate campuses. But with one of them, you would hardly know it.

articles.author: Melissa Korn
articles.title: Do Pro-Women Groups on Campus Discriminate Against Men?
articles.description: The U.S. Education Department opens investigations into whether scholarships and professional networking groups intended to support women at Yale University and the University of Southern California violate federal law by discriminating against men.

articles.author: Robbie Whelan
articles.title: Nafta Talks Stalled on U.S. Auto Demands
articles.description: Talks to renegotiate the North American Free Trade Agreement have reached a stalemate, with Mexico and the U.S. accusing one another of intransigence and inconsistency after missing a key deadline.

articles.author: Bobby Ross Jr., Sarah Pulliam Bailey, Michelle Boorstein
articles.title: Prominent Southern Baptist leader removed as seminary president following controversial remarks about abused women
articles.description: Move follows a massive backlash from women upset over comments he made in the past that are being newly perceived as sexist and demeaning.

articles.title: Trump: Kim changed attitude after chat with Xi - CNN Video
articles.description: President Trump said Kim Jong Un changed his mind about the US-North Korea June summit after chatting with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: Wayne Rooney: Everton forward to meet MLS side DC United this week
articles.description: Everton forward Wayne Rooney is to travel to Washington DC this week to meet Major League Soccer side DC United.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Hundreds mourn Texas victim in Karachi
articles.description: The funeral of student Sabika Sheikh, killed in last week's US school shooting, is held in Karachi.

articles.author: James Griffiths, CNN
articles.title: How to get to North Korea's nuclear site
articles.description: A small coterie of foreign reporters is about to set off on a marathon journey to a remote location in North Korea to witness Pyongyang's purported destruction of the Punggye-ri nuclear test site.

articles.author: Ben Westcott, CNN
articles.title: What the US and North Korea mean when they talk about 'denusclearization'
articles.description: Denuclearization is one of the first words that comes to mind when discussing diplomatic efforts on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Haley: Trump's unpredictability helped with NK - CNN Video
articles.description: US Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley said she used President Trump's unpredictability to get the Chinese to back tougher international sanctions on North Korea.

articles.author: Analysis by Stephen Collinson, CNN
articles.title: Pessimism mounts ahead of historic Trump-Kim nuclear summit
articles.description: President Donald Trump's spur-of-the-moment decision to agree to a face-to-face meeting with North Korea leader Kim Jong Un represented an unprecedented opportunity, but also a huge risk, most recently highlighted by a case of cold feet on both sides.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/emma-g-fitzsimmons
articles.title: A Sweeping Plan to Fix the Subways Comes With a $19 Billion Price Tag
articles.description: The subway’s new leader, Andy Byford, is expected to announce the expensive modernization plan on Wednesday to quickly upgrade the signal system.
